name: Burr Oak Lodge and Conference Center

reviews.text: We recently spent two nights at this newly renovated lodge in Ohio’s Burr Oak State Park. We had a two room King patio suite and were very satisfied with the accommodations. The bed was extremely comfortable, there was nice furniture in the sitting area and there was two new flat screen TVs. The work at the resort is still in progress and we were disappointed that the mini-golf was not completed yet. We did not use the indoor pool but it looked very nice. The dining room in the lodge has a decent but limited menu selection. They were out of several items on the second night making the choices even smaller (this is an important point because of its remote location; there are no alternate dining spots just “down the road”). We found the resort and dining room staff very friendly and accommodating. They even let us tour one of the cabins for future reference. The location is very peaceful and scenic. If you are looking for a place for a nice get-a-way this would be a good choice.
reviews.title: Peaceful getaway, well worth the trip!

reviews.text: The lodge was very nicely decorated and the rooms were very nice. We stayed in the family suites which were very roomy and had two bathrooms and two flat screen tv's as well as a fridge and microwave which made it nice for families. The staff was very nice and accomodating. The swimming pool was large and very nice. We went to the marina and rented a pontoon boat which was fun to do with the kids.
reviews.title: Beautiful Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I felt like they should have had some organized activites for children so there was not a lot to do. Also it would have been nice to have a DVD player in the rooms which there were none. At other state parks we have been at there was usually some sort of campfire going in a fire pit outside and they did not have one of those either.
reviews.title: Nice weekend

reviews.text: Room was nice , must have been one of the smaller kings because only one room but was clean & comfortable. Had all meals @ the dining room were all good & all slow ,think its all new staff since the remodel. Park is beautiful , great hiking right out the door of the Lodge , no one on trails although the lodge was nearly full
reviews.title: Beautiful Lodge

reviews.text: Burr Oak Lodge is approximately 176 miles from our Cleveland area home--40 of those miles on Rt 78 which is VERY WINDY with some VERY SHARP turns!! The lodge is beautiful, all fresh and newly decorated and remodeled. Our king room was very nice and spacious perfectly clean and the bed was outstanding! The room has a microwave, refrigerator and also a one cup coffeemaker and large wide screen tv. We found the dining room to be nice with a small but good menu. The service was good with reasonable enough prices. All lodge staff was very nice and friendly. As far as things to do within the lodge itself, there is only an indoor swimming pool and some board games in the upper sitting area. There is no food to be purchased anywhere besides the restaurant so if you like to snack, bring your own! There are some bottled beverages at the front desk--that's it! We spent some time at the Marina which is a short drive from the lodge. Our stay was pleasant and relaxing which is exactly what we wanted for our weekend. Also the lodge has a great, all new fitness center which is spacious with excellent equipment.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: This is an older lodge and it shows. The bathrooms have an overhead heater which I loved! The decor is dated and the beds were not very comfortable but we loved the lobby which has a nice ping pong table and a game area in the loft. My family really enjoyed playing the games there. The lodge provided board and card games as well as jigsaw puzzles (pieces were scattered so the puzzles might be intact) and legos for everyone. I would pass on the restaurant. We rented a boat from the marina and enjoyed a lovely boat ride on the lake.
reviews.title: Enjoyable

reviews.text: We recently stayed for two nights at the lodge. We had a room with a lake view and the first room we checked into was very clean. The air conditioner was not cooling well, so we asked for another room. The staff was very accommodating and let us check two additional rooms for cooling comfort and we changed rooms. While the A/C unit did cool better, it never worked to peak efficiency. Our room was small (1 double bed, one twin bed) but clean. The pool area was very nice and we enjoyed it! The lodge has a restaurant and we had both breakfast and dinner. The meals and service was very good and their prices were reasonable. As I mentioned, the guest rooms were clean. Some of the other areas could have been better. For two days in the hall way near our room a small pile of leaves and sticks were not cleaned up. The walkways around the lodge also could have been swept off. In the main area of the lodge, the ceiling light fixtures needed to have spider webs cleaned from them. I don't want to sound like a neat freak and portray the lodge in a totally negative light. Overall, we had a very nice stay here and plan to return in the fall.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our visit and plan to stay again, but attention to detail was missing.

reviews.text: Regretfully, we had a bad experience recently at Burr Oak State Park. Even though the Lodge itself was clean and tidy, the grounds were not up to our expectactions for a State Park. The hiking trails were not well-maintained (Large trees down, foot-paths deteriorating, poison ivy everywhere, and the tennis courts were covered with leaves and debris). Also, the lodge lost power after a brief rainstorm and we had no electricity....no lights, air conditioning, etc.) The staff was not helpful and did not seem to have a plan to restore power or notify guests of the details. We left within three hours of arrival and will not return.
reviews.title: Bad Experience

reviews.text: My daughter who is a current Ohio University student and I stayed overnight for mom's weekend. While this state park lodge (and cabins) are off the beaten path and accessed by picturesque country roads, it is worth the drive from campus. Very well run lodge, restaurant, bar, gift shop, front desk, etc. Clean, efficient, staff is very friendly and accommodating. The Saturday ight we checked in they offered live entertainment (two acoustic guitar players, excellent players, some original, some covers). A smattering of older couples, young families with little children were watching (and dancing to) the music and enjoying the main lodge room area (also second floor gameroom/balcony area). We observed the indoor pool area around 10 pm and it was quite an active place with a dozen or so middle school aged children. Also, pool and pool deck was very clean and well stocked with clean towels (although we skipped the pool, with so many children present). Earlier in the evening we opted for pizza delivery and were quite satisfied with our Little Italy pizza (although if you order pizza delivery, remember to ask for napkins and paper plates, we forgot to and I had hoped they'd include them since they knew we were in the lodge but they didn't. The bar hostess was kind enough to give me extra napkins). We booked our room which included breakfast for two in the morning and were very pleased with our meals. Delicious food, served promptly by a very friendly waitress. The view from the dining room is stunning. Finally, since I arise earlier than my college aged daughter (shocking I know), I ordered to-go coffee from the restaurant but they gave it to me for free. I of course generously tipped the hostess. I thought that was a very nice touch and quite unexpected.
reviews.title: Excellent option for visiting Ohio University parents

reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again. Very nice lodge, rooms are extremely clean and bathroom was stocked with plenty of clean towels and also spotless. So spotless I enjoyed a late night soak in the tub (I don't always want to take a bath unless the hotel bathroom is very clean and this one was).
reviews.title: Rustic, off the grid, great service
Improving!
reviews.text: Have stayed At lodge many times in past years as I have family in area and its the only option. Was disappointed when it closed but stayed in one of the cabins and it was ok. Just spent night there and WHAT AN IMPROVEMENT. Stayed in a very nice room that was remodeled. Service was GREAT and you can tell they're working to make it better. I travel a lot and stay in a lot of hotels and the lodge is getting much more competitive. Had pizza, drinks and breakfast in the restaurant and was very pleased with food and service. Looking forward to seeing continued improvement with rest of rooms remodeled and cabins remodeled. The lodge deserves another chance if you haven't tried it recently. Wifi even worked great which was a big improvement! Keep up the great work team at lodge...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there for 2 nights. They had added an indoor pool. They were renovating the rooms, we got a newly done one. Room was great, but the experience was lacking. The contractors ran the place. They parked in the front close to the building the paying guests either had to wait for someone to move or park at the far end of the lot. They were putting up a plastic tree in the lobby near our entry hall way. You either walker under thre workers or climber over their tools to get around to the entry way. At 98.00 per night I expected more. No breakfast on weekdays, Reataurant was open for lunch and dinner. Very pricey. They would not let me use my Ohio STATE PARKS REWARDS CARD. They said it wasn't honored at the lodge.
reviews.title: Second thoughts

reviews.text: After renovation room prices will jump up. This was our one and only visit. Sorry not worth it.
reviews.title: Very good I loved it
Good Lake, Good Trails, that's all that's left. Cabins too.
reviews.text: I love the swimming pool and the games and the ping pong tables and the rooms and it was fun at the dinning room and the front desk and the girls name was brandy was very very great. The lodge was very big and the tennis court was great and I had fun again. Me and my friends lived taking a walk around and hiking we lived look at the gift shop and playing ping pong all the time and we went swimming the whole time we were there my mom loved the coffee there we think u guys should get 40 million stars for ur amazing jobs you have done

The Lodge and Conference Center is closed. The cabins are running but I have not stayed there....yet. I will and let you know how that goes. Many rumors surround the question of why it closed. But whatever. The hiking trails have been cleaned up and marked. There are a lot of miles to be hiked there. Its not over hiked so you must pay attention to keep on the trail. Its important to have a map and compass in case you lose your way. If you have decent amount of hiking under your belt you will enjoy the continuous up and downs of the lake ridge trail. If you are feeling ambitious try the whole 22 mile loop for an all day workout. There was lots of people dropping their boats and quietly fishing. So its quiet but your never alone. Its beautiful and historical if you tend to see things that way. If you want perfectly marked trails that are so well beaten you will never lose your way then this place is most likely not for you. There are nice picnic areas and people seemed to be enjoying themselves with reading and fishing lake shore. We did see the park ranger two times so I would say they are keeping a good eye on whats going on. So bring your boat, your hiking boots and poles, your fishing stuff, your picnic lunch and a smile and you will enjoy. If you don't have those things better head on down the road. Rumor is that soon the lodge may re-open with all kinds of new activities in store. We will see............
reviews.title: Nice cabins. We will go back again.

reviews.text: Stopped at this park on a whim for a one night getaway, Rooms are nicely done, but we found the park to be a bit boring. We were spoiled by the other parks in Ohio like Salt Fork, Mohican and Maumee Bay. It is a nice park for those looking for a less traveled and not as busy place to stay. Just don't expect a whole lot other than the pool. The dining room food is sub par and lukewarm at best for the prices.. Staff is extreamily slow!
reviews.title: If bringing a family choose Salt Fork, or Maumee Bay insted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband took me to Burr Oak to celebrate my birthday; What a peaceful and serene place to stay. We arrived on Friday and stay through Sunday, Driving to Marietta and Belpree on Saturday to visit to local wineries. The road between the Lodge and Marietta is primitive but beautiful, At times being only gravel. The trip is deceptively long based on the miles you drive because the roads are tough. But it was well worth the drive And added to our overall stay.
reviews.title: Birthday Getaway

reviews.text: We understand the lodge was recently remodeled, in fact remodeling is still going on, and reopened after being closed for quite some time. We both hope that they make a go of it and highly recommend it to anybody who's looking for a quiet peaceful place to get away from everything. All we could hear was the birds......:)
reviews.title: Nice and peaceful....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, you're in the middle of nowhere, but that's the beauty of it. My family and I were on a 5 day trip to visit several state parks in Ohio and we started with Burr Oak. We don't know what the lodge was like before the renovations, but we thought our room, a family suite with bunk beds and door dividers, was fantastic. Glad we had the indoor pool since it was rainy when we arrived and after breakfast the next morning, too. I was very impressed with the dining room and what the restaurant menu offered, definitely the best meals we had on our state park visits. I loved the floor to ceiling length glass walls surrounding the whole dining area! Breakfast the next morning was just as good ( I ordered the healthy yogurt, fruit and granola and my children had the pancakes and bacon. BTW, I think it's great that several of the state parks in Ohio are offering children's meals for 99 cents this summer!) The lodge interiors are cozy and we loved how the lodge faced out to the lake.
reviews.title: Renovated Rooms the Best ! - Renovation Still in Progress July 2013

reviews.text: My 3 year old enjoyed the small playground near the lodge and my 9 yr old and my husband got in a quick tennis match before a huge downpour. It looks like the mini golf area should be nice once it's finished.
reviews.title: If you like nature stay here!
